Submodules

src.routing.latency_relaxing module

class src.routing.latency_relaxing.LatencyRelaxing(network_manager, datapaths)[source]

Bases: Routing

This is a latency relaxing algorithm, that chooses the best next one-hop node as the routing strategy. For example, let’s say we have three nodes s1, s2, s3. Let s1 be the source node and s3 be the destination node. If latency of s1-s2 + latency of s2-s3 < latency of s1-s3, then the optimal route from s1-s3 is changed as s1-s2-s3.

Parameters:

  • network_manager (class:NetworkManager) – The network manager object :class: NetworkManager

  • datapaths (dict[str: ryu.controller.controller.Datapath]) – The datapaths map that stores datapath id of the corresponding virtual mininet switch

get_optimal_route(source_dpid, target_dpid)[source]

This is an abstract method, that can be overridden by subclasses. Each subclass implements this method and performs its own strategy to calculate the optimal route. This function is utilized to calculate the optimal route between the source and destination nodes, and return the list of nodes that are contained in this optimal route.

Parameters:

  • source_dpid (int) – Datapath id of the source node

  • target_dpid (int) – Datapath id of the target node

Returns:

A list of datapath switch names

Return type:

list[str]

update_rtt_matrix(latency_results)[source]

Takes a list of :class: Measurement objects and updates the RTT matrix

Parameters:

latency_results (list[Measurement]) – A list of measurement objects that need to be injected into the virtual mininet topology aka rtt matrix

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None

src.routing.routing module

class src.routing.routing.Routing(network_manager, datapaths)[source]

Bases: ABC

This is a base class for routing strategies. Each newly implemented routing strategy should inherit from this class. Each new routing strategy should implement :func: update_rtt_matrix and :func: get_optimal_route

Parameters:

  • network_manager (class:NetworkManager) – The network manager object :class: NetworkManager

  • datapaths (dict[str: ]) – The datapaths map that stores datapath id of the corresponding virtual mininet switch

add_flow(datapath, priority, match, actions, buffer_id=None) → None[source]

Performs flow addition in the mininet topology using SDN controller.

Parameters:

  • datapath (ryu.controller.controller.Datapath) – Ryu switch datapath object

  • priority (int) – Flow priority

  • match (ryu.ofproto.ofproto_v1_2_parser.OFPMatch) – Ryu OFPMatch object

  • actions (ryu.ofproto.ofproto_v1_2_parser.OFPActionOutput) – Ryu SDN actions

  • buffer_id (int | None) – Packet Buffer Id - ID assigned by datapath (OFP_NO_BUFFER if none)

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None

fetch_latency_results(latency_results: list[Measurement]) → None[source]
Takes a list of :class: Measurement objects and performs the following functions

  1. update rtt matrix

  2. calculate the optimal route from source label to destination label

  3. set the optimal route in the underlying mininet topology using SDN controller

Parameters:

latency_results (list[Measurement]) – A list of measurement objects that need to be injected into the virtual mininet topology aka rtt matrix

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None

abstract get_optimal_route(source_dpid: int, target_dpid: int) → list[str][source]

This is an abstract method, that can be overridden by subclasses. Each subclass implements this method and performs its own strategy to calculate the optimal route. This function is utilized to calculate the optimal route between the source and destination nodes, and return the list of nodes that are contained in this optimal route.

Parameters:

  • source_dpid (int) – Datapath id of the source node

  • target_dpid (int) – Datapath id of the target node

Returns:

A list of datapath switch names

Return type:

list[str]

set_ip_flow(x: str, y: str, z: str) → None[source]

Takes in a series of 3 nodes, (x, y, z) and forms links in between them, i.e forms x-y link, y-z link, and y-x link, z-y link

Parameters:

  • x (str) – node name

  • y (str) – node name

  • z (str) – node name

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None

set_optimal_route(dpids: list[str]) → None[source]

Takes in a list of node names, which form a path from source to destination, and sets up the optimal route in the mininet topology using the SDN controller.

Parameters:

dpids (list[str]) – A list of node names

Returns:
